results.title: Synthesis = Synthese. No. 2/78 [English language]
results.brief_description:
French cinemagazine items: The cultural heritage - monuments, famous buildings, yet there are other things too. Common objects, sometimes hidden, sometimes buried, oral evidence…a museum of the past that is never complete, that must be discovered, counted, restored, protected, in order to be passed on. The discovery of a neolithic village near Toulouse; the protection and restoration of stained glass windows of the Middle Ages; methods developed to conserve films of which the oldest have only been in existence 100 years. The Research Laboratory of the Louvre museum places its facilities at the disposal of everyone.
Suitable for senior students.

results.title: Synthesis = Synthese. No. 2/77 [English language]
results.brief_description:
French cinemagazine items: 1. Energy - the foundation of the world’s organisation is a complex economy in a state of permanent development on which a team of researchers is working. 2. A cyclotron in a hospital is used for the observation of organs, like the brain; short life radio-isotopes are made to order by a small accelerator installed in a hospital. 3. “Tanninising” cattle cake is a technique which breaks down the proteins and allows a saving in the region of 20%. 4. The application of metallurgical techniques to Earth Sciences to estimate the consequences of deformations observed in crystals and deformations occurring in mountain masses and the planet.
Suitable for senior students.

results.title: Synthesis = Synthese. No. 2/75 [French language]
results.brief_description:
French cinemagazine items: 1. In 1931 Professor Roger Gautheret experimented with the culture of isolated vegetable cells. Today 200 researchers utilise this technique which could lead on to the production of specific substances in industry. 2. A device which allows the reception of a TV channel from an ordinary telephone box and answers from a co-ordinator. 3. Techniques which today permit us to program the reproduction cycle of ewes in a herd and also nearly double the productivity of the herd. 4. Elastic tissues of arteries and veins develop in parallel, the analysis of an ordinary skin sample allows us to evaluate the state of the arteries and their degree of arteriasclerosis and artheriasclerasis. 5. The knowledge of the state of snow crystals and the conditions leading to the beginning of avalanches opens the way to their prevention…by preventive release and the setting up of avalanche disposal points.
Suitable for senior students. Guide included.
